candidates.title: docs: add missing feature for doc gen
Minimise build profile tweaking in rp/rp235x examples
candidates.body:
To avoid confusion around build profile tweaks (see #4346), remove optimisation/lto changes and just enable generation of debug symbols for release profiles.
Also add a comment explaining that it is intentional so it is less likely to be seen as a mistake in the examples.

candidates.title: Fix Release and Dev Profiles Being Backwards in rp235x Examples
nxp: add feature for lpc55
candidates.body: this is needed since I will be working on adding support for the MCX and iMXRT families to embassy-nxp

candidates.title: Added STM32WBA6XXX devices as features
candidates.body:
Added the following
- new devices (a.k.a. features) from `stm32-data`
- within `ci.sh`: attempt to build 2 `stm32wba6[2|5]` devices
- handled a default rtc implementation if the generated peripherals didn't match the mapping.
- handled a new generated peripheral `rtc_v3c0` recently introduced to `stm32-data-generated`

candidates.title: Adapt to new opamp pin naming scheme and opamp IP version numbers
candidates.body:
The new code implements the corresponding traits for the common opamp pin naming scheme of all families, which is VINPx/VINMx and adapts the opamp driver to new opamp IP version numbers.

The same pin must not be used for multiple channels for the same opamp. For example, if VINM0 and VINM1 of the same opamp were assigned to the same pin, the channel would not be unique, meaning that the traits would be implemented in a conflicting manner.

candidates.title: mspm0: add dma driver
candidates.body:
Add a DMA driver for mspm0. So far only implement features available on all (basic) channels. copying slices is also not implemented yet nor anything related to source/destination stride. 

~~A few things pending before this is ready to review~~
- [x] merge https://github.com/mspm0-rs/mspm0-data/pull/6
- [x] add tests for u16, u32 and u64 transfers
- [x] ~~Figure out why `TransferMode::Single` with `dst.len() > 2` performs 2 transfers instead of 1 (as expected in datasheet)~~ (likely hardware bug)
- [x] ~~Test multiple triggers (`resume()`)~~
- [x] Remove the settings.json changes (after I am done)

candidates.title: Fix sync bounds on LazyLock and OnceLock
candidates.body:
This pull request introduces changes to ensure stricter `Sync` trait implementations for `LazyLock` and `OnceLock` types in the `embassy-sync` crate. It also adds regression tests to verify these changes and prevent incorrect usage of these types with non-`Sync` data. Additionally, a new dependency (`trybuild`) is added for compile-time testing.

### Stricter `Sync` Implementations:

* [`embassy-sync/src/lazy_lock.rs`](diffhunk://#diff-cd31bb3d341607967bd756da8f3d44ab3106dc08d38c7b4ec235230b584c2723L34-R39): Updated the `Sync` implementation for `LazyLock` to require both `T` and `F` to implement `Sync`.
* [`embassy-sync/src/once_lock.rs`](diffhunk://#diff-e8478b2fa15a8e88ebb2d2ea0faecdfc7223d2c3b8c5ccc0ce631aa432d74939L45-R45): Updated the `Sync` implementation for `OnceLock` to require `T` to implement `Sync`.

### Regression Tests for Compile-Time Errors:

* [`embassy-sync/tests/ui.rs`](diffhunk://#diff-b93a33ee71aaf155cb7b6f03478c2859084d60d09bb29b83e108f1b086a32e1fR1-R13): Added compile-fail tests using `trybuild` to ensure `LazyLock` and `OnceLock` do not unconditionally implement `Sync` for non-`Sync` types.
* [`embassy-sync/tests/ui/sync_impl/lazy_lock_function.rs`](diffhunk://#diff-8718c0de6b942640ffb134d6add1b5e573e2841c472cd6be7e5deece2e29a1ecR1-R15): Added a test case where a `LazyLock` is initialized with a closure capturing a non-`Sync` variable, which should fail to compile.
* [`embassy-sync/tests/ui/sync_impl/lazy_lock_type.rs`](diffhunk://#diff-294d2eb1b6946e68e6c4fd888f878c778449d58b7eddaf65770d4838422f484eR1-R6): Added a test case where `LazyLock` is used with a non-`Sync` type (`*mut u8`), which should fail to compile.
* [`embassy-sync/tests/ui/sync_impl/once_lock.rs`](diffhunk://#diff-fd48543eaaf2518651235c829ec4a185716da86bedf3e6f6a3ece260cb9164b9R1-R6): Added a test case where `OnceLock` is used with a non-`Sync` type (`*mut u8`), which should fail to compile.

### Dependency Addition:

* [`embassy-sync/Cargo.toml`](diffhunk://#diff-8ef39bee7253569f3e25944bb7297e3b70d36e6e5308c17c8b0bce9c2cc903f4R46): Added `trybuild` dependency for compile-time testing.

fixes #4307
fixes #3904

candidates.body: Traits are reexported from futures-core, and futures-util takes relatively forever to build.

I've updated the changelog for embassy-sync (I'd like to see a crates.io release with the zerocopy-channel fix).
I think this needs a major bump because of the critical-section std change.

If there are other planned pending embassy-sync changes please don't let this rush a release.

candidates.title: Adding EEPROM support to embassy-stm32
candidates.body: Adding EEPROM support for STM32L0 and STM32L1 series

candidates.title: mspm0: generate interrupt group handlers
candidates.body:
No more ugly `#[path]` attributes or manually written code. The only annoying part is that the user must tell rustc to link the `interrupt_group.x` file.

This does require a little linker *magic*, inspired by `cortex-m-rt`. In the future for other things in interrupt groups I'll write an abstraction to allow binding these. When `#[linkage = "extern_weak"]` is promoted to stable then we can have a far nicer setup than this.

GPIO examples work correctly from my testing. (I should write some tests for these soon eh?).

candidates.title: [embassy-usb-dfu] support ed25519 verification
candidates.body:
This commit adds the ability to verify that USB DFU updates are correctly signed using ed25519.

This required adding support to embassy-boot for reading from the DFU partition.

The memory map for the `stm32wb-dfu` also had to be adjusted to accommodate the larger bootloader.

candidates.title: Add rand-core v0.9 support.
candidates.body:
- Implement rand-core v0.9 in HALs (keeping v0.6 support, same as we do with embedded-hal v0.2 and v1.0)
- Add inherent methods
- Switch most examples to use inherent methods instead of rand-core.

candidates.title: fix: add bank confdiguration doc build features
rp: add missing `Debug` and `defmt::Format` `derive`s for ADC
candidates.body: this doesn't cover every `struct` & co. in `embassy-rp`, but at least it adds those needed for `Adc` and `adc::Channel`.

candidates.title: mspm0: generate features per chip + package
candidates.body:
This pull request along with some work on the mspm0-metapac side now allows the `Peripherals` type to only pins that are available for a chip + package combo. This is to match the behavior in embassy-stm32.

All the examples and tests build and run as intended.

`get_chip_cfgs` is a little cursed but that is temporary since I plan to deal with interrupt groups after this.

Regarding feature names, I have chosen to exclude temperature rating so the same feature is used before a standard (`S`) and Q100 qualfied (`Q1`) part. Embassy doesn't care whether your parts on tape & reel or tray, so distribution method is excluded.

For reference:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2bf4f2b2-52a6-41f1-844d-97cbaec6d512)

Fun fact, there are 128 part numbers for MSPM0 parts. Only 25x less than the STM32. Unfortunately more parts are coming so hopefully TI doesn't catch up soon.

candidates.title: Clarify embassy-rp rt feature purpose
candidates.body:
The original comment was mostly wrong.
Replaced it a brief explanation and a link to the docs which should hopefully give the user better context.
